meanings.definition: Able to be named or identified.
meanings.sent1: The cute puppy was easily nameable by its unique spots.
meanings.sent2: The new species of flower was nameable after the botanist who discovered it.
meanings.sent3: It's funny how some people think clouds are nameable like pets.
meanings.sent4: In a world where every star is nameable, the sky becomes a map of stories.
meanings.sent5: The mysterious creature in the forest was so nameable that it became a local legend.

meanings.definition: Capable of being given a name.
meanings.sent1: The ancient artifact found in the tomb was easily nameable due to its inscriptions.
meanings.sent2: The constellation was nameable by connecting the stars to form a shape.
meanings.sent3: It's amusing how some people believe even ghosts are nameable like pets.
meanings.sent4: Her emotions were nameable only by the colors of the sky at dusk.
meanings.sent5: The scent of fresh bread baking in the oven was so nameable, it brought back memories of childhood.
